qas.question: What was the initial size of the Thames River Police force?
How many dock workers were the Thames River Police policing?
How many dock workers did Colquhoun say were criminals?
How much cargo theft did the Thames River Police prevent in its first year?
When was the Thames River Police made a public service?
What was the final size of the Thames River Police force?
How many deck workers were the Thames River Police policing?
How many dock workers did Colquhoun say weren't criminals?
How much cargo theft did the Thames River Police allow in its first year?
When was the Thames River Police made a private service?

context: With the initial investment of £4,200, the new trial force of the Thames River Police began with about <a0_0><b5_0>50<b5_0/><a0_0/> men charged with policing <a1_0><b6_0>33,000<b6_0/><a1_0/> workers in the river trades, of whom Colquhoun claimed <a2_0><b7_0>11,000<b7_0/><a2_0/> were known criminals and "on the game." The force was a success after its first year, and his men had "established their worth by saving <a3_0><b8_0>£122,000<b8_0/><a3_0/> worth of cargo and by the rescuing of several lives." Word of this success spread quickly, and the government passed the Marine Police Bill on <a4_0><b9_0>28 July 180<a4_0/>0<b9_0/>, transforming it from a private to public police agency; now the oldest police force in the world. Colquhoun published a book on the experiment, The Commerce and Policing of the River Thames. It found receptive audiences far outside London, and inspired similar forces in other cities, notably, New York City, Dublin, and Sydney.
